intro: Solanum wendlandii, commonly known as the wendlandii nightshade, is a shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple color, often containing several seeds. While it is not widely cultivated for food, it is sometimes grown for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
